title: Chhapra - Lucknow Junction Express
context: The Chhapra – Lucknow Junction Express is an express train belonging to North Eastern Railway zone that runs between Chhapra Junction and Lucknow Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 15053/15054 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Chhapra Express
context: Godan Express (Hindi: गोदान एक्स्प्रेस) is a 3 Days a Week Mail/Express Train of the Indian Railways, running between Lokmanya Tilak Terminus, Mumbai, the capital city of Maharashtra and Chhapra, the prominent city of Bihar. It is numbered as 11059/60.

title: Chhattisgarh Express
context:
Chhattisgarh Express (18237/18238) is a well known old Indian train which connects Bilaspur and Amritsar. Its name represents the state of Chhattisgarh.
It was first introduced in year 1978 as Bhopal - Bilaspur Chhattisgarh Aanchal Express and used to run between Bilaspur and Habibganj (Bhopal).
This train was the first train to originate from newly constructed sub-urban railway station Habibganj. In year 1980, the train was extended to main railway station of Bhopal; Bhopal Junction.
Later in year 1987, it was extended to Hazrat Nizamuddin as well as New Delhi and then finally in year 1990 to Amritsar.

title: Chitrakoot Express
context: 15205/15206 Jabalpur - Lucknow Chitrakoot Express is a daily Mail/Express Train of the Indian Railways, which runs between Jabalpur Junction railway station of Jabalpur, an important city & military cantonment hub of Central Indian state Madhya Pradesh and Lucknow railway station, the capital city of Uttar Pradesh. The name "Chitrakoot Express" has been given as this place is very important religious spot near the city of Jabalpur.

title: Cholan Express
context: The Cholan Express (16854/16853) (Officially Tiruchirappalli-Chennai Egmore Express) is an express train operated by the Southern Railway zone of the Indian Railways. This train connects Chennai Egmore and Tiruchirappalli via Villupuram , Mayiladuthurai and Thanjavur in the Indian state of Tamil Nadu. New LHB coaches has been installed for this train since 16 February 2017.

title: Circar Express
context: The Circar Express is a daily express train run by Indian Railways running from Chengalpattu Junction railway station via Egmore Railway station (Chennai) Tamil Nadu to Kakinada Port railway station (COA) via Vijayawada in Andhra Pradesh. Main towns on the way are Nellore, Chirala, Bapatla, Nidubrolu, Tenali, Vijayawada, Gudiwada,Bhimavaram Town,Rajahmundry and Kakinada. The train operates daily and covers a distance of 755 km.

title: Corbett Park Link Express
context: The Corbett Park Link Express is an Express train belonging to North Western Railway zone that runs between Jaisalmer and Ramnagar in India. It is currently being operated with 25013/25014 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Coromandel Express
context: The Coromandal Express is one of the flagship carriers of the Indian Railways. Which runs down the east coast of India between Howrah station (HWH) in Kolkata and Chennai Central (MAS) in Chennai daily. It is one of the first earliest Superfast in the history of IR. The Eastern Coast of India along the Bay of Bengal is called the Coromandal Coast and hence the name was given to this train, as it traverses the entire length of the Coromandal coast. This train belongs to the South Eastern Railway Zone. Most of the people going to Chennai prefer this train as the train arrives early then Howrah Chennai Mail as well as that of Santragachi Chennai Central AC Express. The train runs jampacked throughout the year.

title: Dadar Central - Puducherry Chalukya Express
context: Chalukya Express is an express train of the Indian Railways connecting Puducherry in Puducherry and Dadar Central of Maharashtra. It is currently being operated with 11005 / 11006 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Dadar Central - Tirunelveli Chalukya Express
context: The Dadar Central - Tirunelveli Chalukya Express is an express train of the Indian Railways connecting Tirunelveli Junction in Tamil Nadu and Dadar Central of Maharashtra. It is currently being operated with 11005 / 11006 train numbers on thrice a week basis.

title: Dakshin Express
context: The 12721/12722 Dakshin Express is a superfast express train belonging to Indian Railways that runs between Hyderabad Decan/Visakhapatnam and Hazrat Nizamuddin in India. It is a daily service. It operates as train number 12721 from Hyderabad Decan to Hazrat Nizamuddin and as train number 12722 in the reverse direction.

title: Deccan Express
context: The Deccan Express (Marathi: डेक्कन एक्स्प्रेस) is an express train that leaves daily at 3:30pm, plying between the cities of Pune and Mumbai in India, a distance of 192 km.

title: Deekshabhoomi Express
context: Deekshabhoomi Express, are the Express trains which connect Kolhapur CSMT (Kolhapur, Maharashtra, India) and Dhanbad Junction ( Jharkhand, India). During its travel it covers a distance of 2890 km, for that it takes 60 hrs 15 mins. It runs with an average speed of 47 km/h. During its journey it covers 36 halts and 379 intermediate stations.

title: Dehradun Amritsar Express
context:
The 14631 / 32 Dehradun Amritsar Express is an Express train belonging to Indian Railways - Northern Railway zone that runs between Dehradun & Amritsar Junction in India.
It operates as train number 14631 from Dehradun to Amritsar Junction and as train number 14632 in the reverse direction serving the 4 states of Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, Haryana & Punjab.

title: Delhi Bareilly Express
context:
The 14556 / 55 Bareilly Delhi Express is an Express train belonging to Indian Railways - Northern Railway zone that runs between Delhi & Bareilly in India.
It operates as train number 14556 from Delhi to Bareilly and as train number 14555 in the reverse direction serving the states of Uttar Pradesh & Delhi.

title: Delhi - Barmer Link Express
context: The Delhi - Barmer Link Express is a express train belonging to Northern Railway zone that runs between Old Delhi and Barmer in India. It is currently being operated with 14661/14662 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Delhi - Hoshiarpur Express
context: The Delhi - Hoshiarpur Express is a express train belonging to Northern Railway zone that runs between Old Delhi and Hoshiarpur in India. It is currently being operated with 14011/14012 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Delhi Sarai Rohilla - Bikaner Express (via Sri Ganganagar)
context:
The Delhi Sarai Rohilla - Bikaner SF Express is a Superfast express train belonging to Indian Railways - North Western Railway zone that runs between Bikaner Junction and Delhi Sarai Rohilla in India.
It operates as train number 12456 from Bikaner Junction to Delhi Sarai Rohilla and as train number 12455 in the reverse direction serving the states of Rajasthan, Haryana and Delhi.

title: Devagiri Express
context: The Devagiri Express is a train service operated by the South Central Railway zone of Indian Railways. The train runs between Mumbai and Secunderabad, primarily running on Secunderabad-Manmad section via Kalyan Junction, Nasik Road, Manmad, Aurangabad, Jalna, Parbhani, Purna, Nanded and Nizamabad. The train shares its rakes with Simhapuri Express.

title: Dhanbad - Alappuzha Express
context: The Dhanbad - Alappuzha Express is a express train belonging to East Central Railway zone that runs between Dhanbad Junction and Alappuzha in India. It is currently being operated with 13351/13352 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Dhano Dhanye Express
context: The Dhano Dhanye Express is a express train belonging to Eastern Railway zone that runs between Kolkata and Lalgola in India. It is currently being operated with 13117/13118 train numbers on four days in a week basis.

title: Dhauladhar Express
context: The Dhauladhar Express is a express train belonging to Northern Railway zone that runs between Old Delhi and Pathankot Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 14035/14036 train numbers on Tri-weekly basis.

title: Dhauli Express
context:
The Dhauli Express is a daily train service in India between Puri and Howrah Junction.This train has 2 rakes. Train no 12822 starts from Puri @11:45 and reaches at Howrah Junction @20:15. Train no 12821 starts from Howrah Junction @06:00 and reaches at Puri @14:20. 

It is also the title of a 2007 film starring Samaresh Routray, Mihir Das and Aparajita Mohanty, Siddhanta Mahapatra, Hari wd by Chitta Ranjan Tripathi.

title: Amritsar-Dibrugarh Express
context: Amritsar-Dibrugarh Express is a weekly express train connects Dibrugarh, the Tea City of India in the East with The Golden city Amritsar in the North.

title: Dibrugarh-Chandigarh Express
context: Chandigarh Dibrugarh Express is a weekly superfast express train which connects Chandigarh the capital of Punjab and Haryana in the North with the Tea City of India, Dibrugarh in Assam in the East.

title: Digha - Asansol Express
context: The Digha - Asansol Express is a express train belonging to Eastern Railway zone that runs between Digha and Asansol Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 13505/13506 train numbers on six days in a week basis.

title: Digha - Malda Town Express
context: The Digha - Malda Town Express is a express train belonging to Eastern Railway zone that runs between Malda Town and Digha in India. It is currently being operated with 13417/13418 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Doon Express
context:
The 13009 / 10 Howrah Dehradun Doon Express is an Express train belonging to Indian Railways - Eastern Railway zone that runs between Howrah Junction & Dehradun in India.
It operates as train number 13009 from Howrah Junction to Dehradun and as train number 13010 in the reverse direction serving the state of West Bengal, Jharkhand, Bihar, Uttar Pradesh & Uttarakhand and is one of two trains that connect Howrah & Dehradun, the other train being the 12327 / 28 Upasana Express.

title: Double Decker Express
context: Double Decker Express are fully air-conditioned two floor express trains. They have high priority and are considered among fast trains in India.

title: Durg - Ambikapur Express
context: The Durg - Ambikapur Express is an express train belonging to South East Central Railway zone that runs between Durg Junction and Ambikapur in India. It is currently being operated with 18241/18242 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Durg - Jagdalpur Express
context: The Durg - Jagadalpur Express is an express train belonging to South East Central Railway zone that runs between Durg Junction and Jagdalpur in India. It is currently being operated with 18211/18212 train numbers on tri-weekly basis.

title: Durg - Jaipur Weekly Express
context: The Durg - Jaipur Weekly Express is an express train belonging to South East Central Railway zone that runs between Durg Junction and Jaipur Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 18213/18214 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Durg - Jammu Tawi Express
context: The Durg - Jammu Tawi Express is an express train belonging to South East Central Railway zone that runs between Durg Junction and Jammu Tawi in India. It is currently being operated with 18215/18216 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Durg - Nautanwa Express (via Sultanpur)
context: The Durg - Nautanwa Express is a express train belonging to South East Central Railway zone that runs between Durg Junction and Nautanwa in India. It is currently being operated with 18205/18206 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Durg Express
context: The 18201/18202 Durg Express is a Mail/Express train belonging to South East Central Railway zone of Indian Railways that run between Durg and Nautanwa in India. It operates as train number 18201 from Durg to Nautanwa and as train number 18202 in the reverse direction.

title: Durgavati Express
context:
The Durgavati Express or Jabalpur - Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Katra Express is a weekly Mail/Express train service run by West Central Railway, It runs between Jabalpur Junction railway station of Jabalpur, an important military hub of Eastern Madhya Pradesh state and Katra railway station of Jammu & Kashmir in India.

It operates as train number 11449 from Jabalpur Junction to Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Katra and as train number 11450 in the reverse direction serving the states of Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Haryana, Delhi, Punjab, India and Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Dwarka Express
context: Okha - Guwahati Dwarka Express is an express train of the Indian Railways connecting Okha in Gujarat and Guwahati Junction in Assam. It is currently being operated with 15635/15636 train numbers on once in week.

title: East Bengal Express
context: The East Bengal Express was a railway train that was one of three train services running between India and Bangladesh (then East Pakistan). The railway link was suspended at the outbreak of the Indo-Pakistani War of 1965.

title: East Bengal Mail
context: The East Bengal Mail was a railway train that was one of three train services running between India and East Pakistan (now Bangladesh). The railway link was suspended at the outbreak of the Indo-Pakistani War of 1965.

title: East Coast Express (India)
context: The East Coast Express is a daily train running between Hyderabad and Howrah (near Kolkata). This train numbered 18645/46 takes 30 hours to cover the distance of 1592 km due to lot of stops on the way.

title: Ekatmata Express
context: Ekatmata Express is an intercity train of the Indian Railways connecting Mughal Sarai Junction in Uttar Pradesh and Lucknow Charbagh of Uttar Pradesh. It is currently being operated with 14259/14260 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Ernad Express
context:
The Ernad Express is an express train run by the Southern Railway zone of the Indian Railways between Mangalore Central railway station in Karnataka and Nagercoil Junction railway station in Tamil Nadu. It longitudinally crosses the whole state of Kerala. It was first introduced in 2009 to run between Mangalore and Kochuveli, satellite station of Trivandrum, the capital of kerala as a tri weekly express and later got extended to Nagercoil. Now this train runs as a daily service.The train runs via Shoranur Junction and Alappuzha.

Train number 16605 runs from south to north and on the return journey, the train number 16606 runs from Nagercoil to Mangalore. The train has stoppage at Manjeshwar, Kumbala, Kasaragod, Kanhangad, Nileshwar, Cheruvathur, Payyannur, Valapattanam, Kannur, Thalassery, Mahe, Vatakara, Payyoli, Koyilandy, Kozhikode, Feroke, Vallikkunnu, Parappanangadi, Tanur, Tirur, Kuttippuram, Pattambi, Shoranur Junction, Thrissur Railway Station, Chalakudy, Aluva, Ernakulam Junction (South), Thuravoor, Cherthala, Alappuzha, Ambalapuzha, Harippad, Kayamkulam, Karunagappally, Kollam Junction, Varkala, Thiruvananthapuram Central, Neyyattinkara and Kulitthurai.

title: Ernakulam - Kannur Express
context: The Alappuzha - Kannur Executive Express is an express train belonging to Southern Railway zone that runs between Ernakulam and Kannur in India. It is currently being operated with 16313/16314 train numbers on bi-weekly basis.

title: Faizabad Delhi Express
context: Faizabad Delhi Express is a train which runs between Faizabad and Old Delhi. Though there are several trains that run to Delhi via Faizabad Railway Station, Faizabad Delhi Express is the only train which starts at Faizabad Jn. to Delhi Jn. It runs daily from Faizabad to Delhi and from Delhi to Faizabad.

title: Falaknuma Express
context: Falaknuma Express (12703/12704) is an Superfast Express operated between Howrah and Secunderabad.

title: Farakka Express
context:
Farakka Express is a normal mail/express type train of Indian Railways connecting Murshidabad and Malda districts of West Bengal with the national capital Delhi. This train is in much demand from the peoples of the district of Malda and Murshidabad. It covers a distance of 1422 km at an average speed of 42kmph. This train halts at:-
Malda Town
New Farakka Junction
Barharwa Junction
Sahibganj Junction
Kahalgaon
Bhagalpur Junction
Jamalpur Junction
Kiul Junction
Barh
Patna Junction
Danapur
Mughalsarai Junction
Dildarnagar railway station Junction
Varanasi Junction
Jaunpur Junction
Lucknow Charbagh
Kanpur Central
Aligarh Junction
Tundla Junction
Delhi Junction
Coach Composition of this train is as follows: HCPV-1, SLR-2, SL-9, GEN-6, 3AC-1, 2AC-1, PC-1; Total 21 coaches.
13413 Farakka express leaves Malda Town station at 19:10 on Monday, Thursday, Saturday and reaches Delhi Junction at 4:30 on second day.
13414 Farakka express departs Delhi Junction at 21:50 on Monday, Wednesday, Saturday and reaches Malda Town station 7:20 on second day.Pantry car and Tatkal scheme is available in this train.
It is hauled by WAP-4/WAP-5 locomotive from Old Delhi to Lucknow Charbagh and from Lucknow Charbagh, WDM-3D class diesel locomotive puts it into action.

title: Farakka Express (via Faizabad)
context: The Farakka Express is a express train belonging to Eastern Railway zone that runs between Malda Town and Old Delhi in India. It is currently being operated with 13483/13484 train numbers on four days in a week basis.

title: Farrukhabad - Kasganj Express
context: The Farrukhabad - Kasganj Express is an express train belonging to North Eastern Railway zone that runs between Farrukhabad Junction and Kasganj Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 15039/15040 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Farukhnagar - Saharanpur Janta Express
context: The Farukhnagar - Saharanpur Janta Express is a express train belonging to Northern Railway zone that runs between Farukhnagar and Saharanpur Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 14545/14546 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Firozpur Cantonment - Shri Ganganagar Express
context: The Firozpur Cantonment - Shri Ganganagar Express is a express train belonging to Northern Railway zone that runs between Firozpur Cantonment and Shri Ganganagar Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 14601/14602 train numbers on weely basis.

title: Ganadevata Express
context:
Ganadevata express is an important Mail/Express type day-running train operated by Indian Railways; it connects Kolkata with Azimganj, a town in Murshidabad district of West Bengal. It is hauled by WAP 4 class electric locomotives from Howrah to Rampurhat. Then WDM 3A diesel locomotive take charge from Rampurhat to Azimganj jn.
The Ganadevata express is used extensively by pilgrims going to visit the Tarapith temple of Rampurhat. It previously ran between Howrah and Rampurhat, and was later extended to run to Azimganj; it covers 278 Kilometers distance at an average speed of 42 Kmph. Coach types in the train include AC chair car, second class sitting, and general, but it does not have a Pantry car. All the classes except general class require reservations. The train leaves Howrah junction at 06:05 to arrive at Azmiganj junction at 13:05, and leaves Azmiganj at 15:30 to arrive at Howrah at 21:45. guskara station also.

title: Gandhidham - Bangalore City Express
context: The Gandhidham - Bangalore City Express is an express train belonging to South Western Railway zone that runs between Gandhidham Junction and Bangalore City in India. It is currently being operated with 16505/16506 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Gandhidham - Kamakhya Express
context: Gandhidham - Kamakhya Express is an express train of the Indian Railways connecting Gandhidham Junction in Gujarat and Kamakhya Junction in Assam. It is currently being operated with 15667/15668 train numbers on once in week.

title: Ganga Damodar Express
context: The Ganga Damodar Express is a express train belonging to East Central Railway zone that runs between Dhanbad Junction and Patna Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 1332/13330 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Ganga Gomti Express
context:
The 14215 / 16 Allahabad Lucknow Ganga Gomti Express is an express train belonging to Indian Railways - Northern Railway zone that runs between Allahabad Junction and Lucknow Junction in India.
It operates as train number 14215 from Allahabad Junction to Lucknow NR and as train number 14216 in the reverse direction serving the state of Uttar Pradesh.

title: Ganga Kaveri Express
context: Ganga Kaveri Express is a Bi-weekly Superfast train service operated by Indian Railways, connecting Chennai in Southern India to Chhapra in Bihar. Inaugurated on 16 February 1977 by Kamalpati Tripathi, between Madras (now Chennai) and Varanasi, was terminating at Chennai Beach Station, from where MG Ganga Kaveri Express used to run to Rameswaram through the Kaveri river basin.

title: Ganga Sagar Express
context:
The Ganga Sagar Express is a express train belonging to Eastern Railway zone that runs between Sealdah and Jaynagar in India. It is currently being operated with 13185/13186 train numbers on weekly basis.
It covers a distance of 624 Kilometers at an average speed of 43 Kmph. Both trains are hauled by a Howrah Loco Shed based WAP-4 or Asansol Loco Shed based WAM-4 electric locomotive from Kolkata to Samastipur. From Samastipur it is hauled by a Samastipur Loco Shed based WDM 3A diesel locomotive up to Jaynagar and vice versa.
It includes coaches of general, AC two tier, AC three tier, and sleeper class, but does not include a pantry car. The Tatkal scheme is available.

title: Ganga Sutlej Express
context: Ganga Sutlej Express is an express train belonging to Indian Railways that run between Dhanbad Junction and Firozpur Cantonment in India.

title: Garhwal Express
context:
The 14044 / 43 Delhi Kotdwara Garhwal Express is an Express train belonging to Indian Railways - Northern Railway zone that runs between Delhi & Kotdwara in India.
It operates as train number 14044 from Delhi to Kotdwara and as train number 14043 in the reverse direction serving the states of Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh & Delhi.

title: Garib Nawaz Express
context: The Garib Nawaz Express is an express passenger train connecting the Indian cities of Kishanganj and Ajmer. This is a direct train between Kishanganj and Ajmer. This is train connects the Eastern and Northern parts of India covering Bihar, Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan.

title: Garudadri Express
context: The Garudadri Express is an express train belonging to South Western Railway zone that runs between Chennai Central and Tirupati in India. It is currently being operated with 16203/16204 train numbers on a daily basis.

title: Kamakhya - Gaya Weekly Express
context: Gaya - Kamakhya Weekly Express is an Express train of the Indian Railways connecting Gaya Junction in Bihar and Kamakhya Junction in Assam. It is currently being operated with 15619/15620 train numbers on once in week basis.

title: Ghazipur City - Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Katra Weekly Express
context: The Ghazipur City - Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Katra Weekly Express is a express train belonging to Northern Railway zone that runs between Ghazipur City and Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Katra in India. It is currently being operated with 14611/14612 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Gita Jayanti Express
context: Gita Jayanti Express is an express train of the Indian Railways connecting Mathura Junction in Uttar Pradesh and Kurukshetra Junction of Haryana. It is currently being operated with 11901/11902 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Gitanjali Express
context: Gitanjali Express is a daily train running between two metro cities, Kolkata, (Howrah Station) in West Bengal and Mumbai, (Mumbai CST) in Maharashtra connecting the East with the West. Numbered 12859/60 this train belongs to the superfast category. This train takes 30½ hrs to cover the distance of 1968 km between Mumbai and Howrah while the return takes 31.5 hrs. This is first train which depart behind pure AC Loco from Mumbai CST after conversion of Mumbai CST to Thane from DC to AC.

title: Goa Express
context:
The Goa Express is a daily superfast train run by Indian Railways connecting Vasco da Gama, and Hazrat Nizamuddin in New Delhi. It is one of the high priority superfast trains of Indian Railways and also a very important train for Hubli division of South Western Railway.
This train is similar to trains like Karnataka Express, Telangana Express and Andhra Pradesh Express amongst others in providing convenient link between respective state capitals and New Delhi. Vasco da Gama (IR Code: VSG) is the nearest railhead to the capital of Goa, Panjim. Panjim is not directly accessible by rail.

title: Godaan Express
context: Godan Express numbered as 11055/11056 is a 4 Days a Week Mail/Express Train of the Indian Railways, running between Lokmanya Tilak Terminus, Mumbai, the capital city of Maharashtra and Gorakhpur Junction, the prominent city of Uttar Pradesh.Godaan Express shares its rake with Chhapra Express.

title: Godavari Express
context: Godavari Express (numbered:12727/12728) is an express train of South Central Railway, operated between Visakhapatnam and Hyderabad.

title: Gol Gumbaz Express
context: The Gol Gumbaz Express (16535/16536) is a Daily Express train running between Mysore and Solapur via Bangalore City, Arsikere, Davanagere, Hubli, Gadag, Bagalkot and Bijapur. Numbered 16535/36 the train is an Express train of Indian Railways of South Western Railway Zone, Bangalore Division.

title: Golconda Express
context: Golconda Express (numbered:17201/17202) is an intercity express train running between Secunderabad and Guntur.

title: Gomti Express
context:
The 12419 / 20 Lucknow New Delhi Gomti Express is a Superfast express train belonging to Indian Railways - Northern Railway zone that runs between Lucknow NR and New Delhi in India.
It operates as train number 12419 from Lucknow NR to New Delhi and as train number 12420 in the reverse direction serving the states of Delhi & Uttar Pradesh.
It is named after the Gomti River which flows through Lucknow.

title: Gomti Sagar Express
context:
The 16093 / 94 Gomti Sagar Express is a Express train belonging to Indian Railways southern zone that runs between Chennai Central and Lucknow Charbagh in India.
It operates as train number 16093 from Chennai Central to Lucknow Charbagh and as train number 16094 in the reverse direction serving the states of Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh.

title: Gondwana Express
context:
The Jabalpur - Hazrat Nizamuddin Gondwana Express is a superfast express train of West Central Railway in India. It runs between Jabalpur Junction and Hazrat Nizamuddin daily.
This Train was discontinued in the Railway 2013-14.
Following is a detailed Gondwana express train schedule

title: Gorakhdham Express
context:
Gorakhdham Express is a daily Superfast class train service of Indian Railways, which runs between the cities of Gorakhpur and Hissar via state capital of Uttar Pradesh; Lucknow, city of Kanpur and national capital New Delhi.
It is considered as one of the important trains of North Eastern Railway and Indian Railways as well.

title: Gorakhpur - Anand Vihar Express
context: The Gorakhpur - Anand Vihar Express is an express train of the Indian Railways connecting Gorakhpur in Uttar Pradesh and Anand Vihar Terminal in Delhi via Basti. It is currently being operated with 15057/15058 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Gorakhpur - Bandra Terminus Express (via Barhni)
context: The Gorakhpur - Bandra Terminus Express is an express train belonging to North Eastern Railway zone that runs between Gorakhpur Junction and Bandra Terminus in India. It is currently being operated with 15067/15068 train numbers on a weekly basis.

title: Gorakhpur - Dehradun Rapti Ganga Express
context:

title: Gorakhpur-Pune Weekly Express
context:
15029/15030 Gorakhpur-Pune Weekly Express is the Mail/Express train of the Indian Railways connecting Pune in Maharashtra and Gorakhpur of Uttar Pradesh.
It has inaugurated at Thursday March 26, 2015. At any given time the 15029 Gorakhpur - Pune Weekly Express always gets the normal priority like other mail/express, on any line.
The 15029/15030 Gorakhpur - Pune weekly Express left Gorakhpur Junction railway station for Pune Junction railway station, to cover a distance of 1,750 km (1,090 mi)  km in 34 hours 40 mins. It Had an 1-1 AC 2&3-Tier and 8 3-Tier Sleeper. Also, The train is the third Mail/Express Train between Gorakhpur Junction railway station to Pune Junction railway station in India and other all trains are Mail/Express Indian trains.

title: Imperial Indian Mail
context:
The Imperial Indian Mail was a train from Bombay to Calcutta during the British Raj. The train was a part of a maritime rail system that carried mail and passengers from London to Calcutta (and on to Rangoon) by a mix of ships and trains. Passengers traveled by train from London to Brindisi in Italy. Then by boat from Brindisi to Bombay's Ballard Pier where they could directly board the Imperial India Mail for a 40-hour journey to Howrah. Passengers heading to Rangoon could transfer to a steamer after a short boat ride from the rail station at Howrah to the pier at Outram Ghat.
The train was featured in a 1939 film of the same title starring Noor Jehan and Gulzar. In E. M. Forster's novel, A Passage to India, the train that Mrs. Moore and Adela Quested took to get to Chandrapore was, most likely, the Imperial Indian Mail.

title: Indore - Bareilly Weekly Express

title: Janmabhoomi Express
context:
The Janmabhoomi Express (12805 / 12806) is an InterCity service of Indian Railways that travels from Secunderabad to Visakhapatnam. It was first introduced between Visakhapatnam and Vijayawada Jn. It was later extended up to Tenali and then the Nagarjuna Express(Secunderabad-Tenali-Secunderabad) was cancelled and thus made the Visakhapatnam-Secunderabad Janmabhoomi express via Tenali. It is an express service that travels in Andhra Pradesh. The train travels at an average speed of 55 km/h and uses a WDM from Secunderabad to Vijayawada but then switches to a WDP4 or a WDM3A to Visakhapatnam. It is classified as a superfast train in the Indian Railways classification list.
Janmabhoomi has 24 coaches, of which 10 are unreserved and the rest for second class and 3 AC chair car. Daily one train will start at Visakhapatnam and one will start from Secunderabad station in Secunderabad train will start by 7:10 and it will reach Visakhapatnam by 19:40 and train from Visakapatnam will start by 6:15 and it will reach Secunderabad by 18:45

On 4 August 2015, this train was involved in this Harda twin train derailment in Madhya Pradesh.

title: Kamrup Express
context:
The Kamrup Express is a daily express train which connects Howrah (Kolkata) in West Bengal with Dibrugarh, which is a major town in upper Assam. Originally the train ran between Howrah and Guwahati (which is the district headquarters of Kamrup District Assam), hence the name. Later it was extended to Dibrugarh Town after the successful conversion of Guwahati-Lumding-Dibrugarh from meter gauge to broad gauge. The train belongs to North East Frontier Railway of Indian Railway and is operated by Tinsukia division of NF Railway. The train is numbered as 15959/15960.
15959 departs Howrah every day at 17:35 and reaches Dibrugarh on the day following the day after, at 04:50 in the morning, covering a distance of 1582 km in 35 hrs 15 mins with an average moving speed of 42 km/h. On the way it passes through Bandel, Nabadwip Dham, Katwa, Berhampore(Khagraghat Road),Azimganj jn, Malda Town, Kishanganj, New Jalpaiguri, New Coochbehar, New Alipurduar, Kamakhyaguri, Fakiragram, Kokrajhar, New Bongaigaon, Guwahati, Lumding, Dimapur, Mariani, Duliajan, New Tinsukia en route to Dibrugarh. The train as an extended halt at Guwahati arriving at 15:40.
15960 departs Dibrugarh every day at 18:20 and reaches Howrah at 5:35 day after covering a distance of 1582 km in 35 hrs and 15 min with an average moving speed of 50 km/h. It stops at New Tinsukia, Duliajan, Mariani (Jorhat), Dimapur, Lumding, Guwahati, New Bongaigaon, kokrajhar,fakiragram, Kamakhyaguri, New Alipurduar, New Coochbehar, New Jalpaiguri, Kishengunj, Malda Town,Azimganj jn,Khagraghat Road,Katwa,Nabadwip Dham, Bandel en route to Howrah. It has an extended halt at Guwahati and departs at 7:35 in the morning next day for Howrah.

The train has both AC and non AC accommodation, and one pantry car.
Both 15959 and 15960, throughout the entire length of the journey from Howrah to Dibrugarh and vice versa, are hauled by a WDM-3A from the diesel loco shed at Howrah. This train is one of the slowest trains between Guwahati and Howrah, but the maintenance of the coaches is very good and the condition of the coaches of this train is very good, with proper passenger facilities included. Recently this train was awarded the ISO certificate, and it is the only train of NF Railways to have been ISO certified, and one of the few in the fleet of Indian Railways, with proper passenger amenities and facilities. This is one of the oldest running trains of NF Railway (Assam Railway before) and is considered as a very important train and as the pride of the zone.

title: Kanchan Kanya Express
context:
The 13149 / 50 Sealdah Alipurduar JN. Kanchan Kanya Express is an Express train belonging to Indian Railways - Eastern Railway zone that runs between Sealdah & Alipurduar Junction in India.
It operates as train number 13149 from Sealdah to Alipurduar Junction and as train number 13150 in the reverse direction serving the state of West Bengal.

title: Kanchenjunga Express
context:
Kanchanjungha Express is an important mail/express type train of Indian Railways linking state of West Bengal, Assam.
Previously it used to run between Howrah and New Jalpaiguri, but was later extended up to Guwahati Junction.
Now it runs between Sealdah (Kolkata) and Guwahati. It is now extended up to Silchar from February 1st 2016 and Agartala from first week of October, 2016.
It runs triweekly from Silchar and biweekly from Agartala and Guwahati. It is equally important among tourists and pilgrims.This train is very Important in this route after Saraighat Express. Tatkal scheme is available in it. 
It is named after the Kanchanjunga peak of the Himalayan Mountains.

title: Kanpur Central - Anand Vihar Terminal Express
context: The Kanpur Central - Anand Vihar Terminal Express is a express train belonging to North Central Railway zone that runs between Kanpur Central and Anand Vihar Terminal in India. It is currently being operated with 14151/14152 train numbers on weelky basis.

title: Kanpur Central - Kasganj Express
context: The Kanpur Central - Kasganj Express is an express train belonging to North Eastern Railway zone that runs between Kanpur Central and Kasganj Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 15037/15038 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Kanyakumari Express
context: The Kanyakumari Express is a superfast daily overnight service train operated by Southern Railway zone of Indian Railways.

title: Karmabhoomi Express
context: Karmabhoomi Express is an superfast train of the Indian Railways connecting Amritsar Junction in Punjab and New Jalpaiguri Junction Junction of West Bengal. It is currently being operated with 12405/12406 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Karnataka Express
context: The Karnataka Express is a daily Superfast train that runs between the Bangalore City, the Capital of Karnataka and the Indian Capital New Delhi. It is one of the most punctual and demanded trains, joining New Delhi to South India.

title: Kashi Express
context: Kashi Express numbered as 15017/15018 is a regular mail/express train of Indian Railways, running between Lokmanya Tilak Terminus, Mumbai, the capital city of Maharashtra, and Gorakhpur Junction, the prominent city of Uttar Pradesh.

title: Kashi Vishwanath Express
context:
Kashi Vishwanath Express is an Indian express train that runs between Varanasi Junction in Uttar Pradesh and New Delhi Railway Station.
The train is named after the Kashi Vishwanath Temple in Varanasi. Main towns along the way are Pratapgarh, Amethi, Rae Bareli, Lucknow, Hardoi, Bareilly, Moradabad, Amroha and Ghaziabad. It operates daily and covers a distance of 794 kilometres (493 mi). Kashi Vishwanath Express offers first A/C, second A/C, third A/C and sleeper class coaches and pantry car services. The Kashi Vishwanath Express is usually hauled by a WDP4D Locomotive.It's average running speed is not good.

title: Kathgodam Express
context: The 14119/14120 Kathgodam Express is a express train belonging to Indian Railways that runs between Kathgodam and Dehradun in India. It operates as train number 14119 from Kathgodam and Dehradun and as train number 14120 in the reverse direction.

title: Kaveri Express
context: Kaveri Superfast Express is a daily train running between Mysuru and Chennai. This train is also known as the Mysuru-Chennai Express. Numbered 12039/40, this train belongs to Southern Railway and is maintained at Chennai.

title: Kaziranga Express
context: Bangalore Cantonment - Guwahati Superfast Express, also known as Kaziranga Express is a tri-weekly super fast express train run by the Northeast Frontier Railway zone of the Indian Railways between Guwahati, Assam and Bangalore, Karnataka.

title: Kerala Express
context: The Kerala Express is a super fast express train of the Indian Railways that runs between New Delhi and Thiruvananthapuram Central in Kerala state. It covers a distance of 3,032 kilometers when it runs from New Delhi to Thiruvananthapura m with 40 stops at an average speed of 110 km/h. This train currently holds the record of being the second longest running daily superfast train in India.

context: The Khajuraho - Udaipur City Express is a express train belonging to North Western Railway zone that runs between Khajuraho and Udaipur City in India. It is currently being operated with 19665/19666 train numbers on twice in a daily basis.

context: The Kisan Express is a express train belonging to North Central Railway zone that runs between Old Delhi Junction and Bathinda Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 14519/14520 train numbers on daily basis. ref>Cancellation Of Trains</ref>

context: Kochuveli - Amritsar Weekly Express is an superfast train of the Indian Railways connecting Kochuveli in Kerala and Amritsar Junction of Punjab. It is currently being operated with 12483/12483 train numbers on weekly basis.

context: The Kochuveli - Indore Weekly Express is a weekly mail express train of the Indian Railways, running between Thiruvananthapuram Central railway station of Thiruvananthapuram, the capital city of Kerala and Indore Junction BG railway station of Indore, the largest city and commercial capital of Madhya Pradesh. It is currently being operated with 19331UP/19332DN train numbers on daily basis.

context: The Kolkata - Ghazipur City Weekly Express is a express train belonging to Eastern Railway zone that runs between Kolkata and Ghazipur City in India. It is currently being operated with 13121/13122 train numbers on weekly basis.

context: Kolkata - Jammu Tawi Express is an Express train of the Indian Railways connecting Kolkata in West Bengal and Jammu Tawi in Jammu and Kashmir. It is currently being operated with 13151/13152 train numbers on every day week.

title: Kolkata - Jaynagar Weekly Express
context: The Kolkata - Jaynagar Weekly Express is a express train belonging to Eastern Railway zone that runs between Kolkata and Jaynagar in India. It is currently being operated with 13135/13136 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Kolkata - Jogbani Express
context: The Kolkata - Jogbani Express is a express train belonging to Eastern Railway zone that runs between Kolkata and Jogbani in India. It is currently being operated with 13159/13160 train numbers on twice in a week basis.

title: Kolkata - Patna Express
context: The Kolkata - Patna Express is a express train belonging to Eastern Railway zone that runs between Kolkata and Patna Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 13131/13132 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Kolkata - Radhikapur Expresss
context: The Kolkata - Radhikapur Express is a express train belonging to Eastern Railway zone that runs between Kolkata and Radhikapur in India. It is currently being operated with 13145/13146 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Kolkata - Sitamarhi Express
context: The Kolkata - Sitamarhi Express is a express train belonging to Eastern Railway zone that runs between Kolkata and Sitamarhi Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 13165/13166 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Kolkata Mail
context: The Kolkata Mail (via Chheoki) is a daily train running between two metro cities Kolkata, (Howrah Station) in West Bengal and Mumbai, (Mumbai CST) in Maharashtra. Numbered 12321/22, the train belongs to the superfast category.

title: Konark Express
context: The Konark Express was one of the classless superfast trains introduced by Shri Madhu Dandavate in the 1978 as a daily service between (SC)Secunderabad and Bhubaneshwar(BBS). It used to run with train No 2119/2120 and shared rake with the 2101/2102 Minar Superfast Express which used to operate between Secunderabad and Bombay VT (now CSTM). This train initially had the Navy Blue livery with a white strip above its windows due to this rake sharing arrangement. With increase in demand of an exclusive train between Bombay and Bhubaneshwar, this train was extended up to Bombay VT in 1994 thus ending the rake sharing arrangement between 2101/2102 Minar Express (which was later replaced by the 2701/02 Hussainsagar Express). After extension this train was renumbered as 1019/1020 in the year 1994. It is one of the oldest trains connecting the eastern and western states of the country.Currently operating as 11019/11020, it connects Mumbai Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus (CSTM) to Bhubaneshwar (BBS).

title: Kondaveedu Express
context:
The 17211 / 17212 Kondaveedu Express train belonging to Indian Railways - South Central Railway zone is a tri-weekly train that runs between Machilipatnam and Yesvantpur Junction in India.
It operates as train number 17211 from Machilipatnam to Yesvantpur Junction and as train number 17212 in the reverse direction serving the state of Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka.

title: Kongu Express
context: Kongu express (Train Nos 12647/12648) is a superfast weekly train run by Indian Railways between Coimbatore city Junction and H.Nizamuddin. The train was named after the Kongu region of Tamil Nadu, called Kongu Nadu. The train made its inaugural run on 3 April 2000.

title: Konkan Kanya Express
context: The Konkan Kanya Express is a Superfast Indian Railways train running between Mumbai and Madgaon on the Konkan Railway route.

title: Korba-Visakhapatnam Express
context: The Korba-Visakhapatnam Express is a daily train in India that runs between Korba in Chhattisgarh and Visakhapatnam in Andhra Pradesh, travelling through much of Odisha. It began to operate in 1989. The route is 731 km long and passes through 31 stations.

title: Kosi Express
context: The Kosi Express is an express train belonging to South Eastern Railway zone that runs between Purnia Court and Patna Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 18697/18698 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Kota - Jaipur Express
context: The Kota - Jaipur Express is a Express train belonging to West Central Railway zone that runs between Kota Junction and Jaipur Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 19807/19808 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Kota - Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Katra Weekly Express
context: The Kota - Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Katra Weekly Express is an Express train belonging to West Central Railway zone that runs between Kota Junction and Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Katra in India. It is currently being operated with 19803/19804 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Kota - Udhampur Weekly Express
context: The Kota - Udhampur Weekly Express is a Express train belonging to West Central Railway zone that runs between Kota Junction and Udhampur in India. It is currently being operated with 19805/19806 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Kovai Express
context: The Kovai Express (Train Number: 12675/12676) is a daily superfast express train on Indian Railways, running between Chennai Central and Coimbatore city Junction. The train made its inaugural run on 14 April 1977 and was one of the fastest Express trains in India, with an average speed of 65 km/hr including stops . It is also one of the most prestigious trains of Southern Railway.

title: Koyna Express
context:
The 11029/11030 Koyna Express is one of 3 daily dedicated express train belonging to Indian Railways that run between Mumbai and Kolhapur in India. It operates as train number 11029 from Mumbai CST to Kolhapur and as train number 11030 in the reverse direction. The other two daily trains on the Mumbai and Kolhapur run are 11023/24 Sahyadri Express & 17411/12 Mahalaxmi Express.
This train is named after the Koyna river that flows across Maharashtra.

title: Krishak Express
context: Krishak Express is an Indian Railways train of North Eastern Railway Zone, Varanasi, Division. It operates daily and covers a distance of 513 kilometres (319 mi) from Varanasi City to Lucknow Junction. Krishak Express consists of 22 coaches which includes 1- AC 1st class, 2 - AC 2 tier, 2 - AC 3 tier, 8 - Sleeper class coaches, 7 - General (unreserved) coaches and 2 - SLR total 22 coaches.

title: Krishna Express
context: Krishna Express (numbered: 17405/17406) is an intercity express train running between Tirupati Main of Andhra Pradesh and Adilabad of Telangana. It belongs to South Central Railway of Indian Railways and it takes 24 hours and 50 minutes to cover 1,148 km (713 mi) between its nodal stations.

title: Kriya Yoga Express
context:
The 18615 / 16 Kriyayoga Express, formerly known as Howrah Hatia Express is an Express train belonging to Indian Railways - South Eastern Railway zone that runs between Howrah Junction & Hatia in India.
It operates as train number 18615 from Howrah Junction to Hatia Junction and as train number 18616 in the reverse direction serving the states of West Bengal & Jharkhand.

title: Kushinagar Express
context:
The Kushinagar Express is an Indian Railways train running between Lokmanya Tilak Terminus (Mumbai) and Gorakhpur. It is numbered as 11015/11016. The train is named after the town of Kushinagar, an important Buddhist pilgrim centre near Gorakhpur. This is a highly demanded train with 15 Sleeper coaches, one second AC coach, two third AC coach, one pantry car and five general coaches. It was provided with LHB coaches on 8 February 2016
The train takes nearly 33 hours to complete the distance of 1679 km, .

title: Lal Bagh Express
context: The Lalbagh Express is a train in India, linking Bangalore City Railway Station and Chennai Central.

title: Lal Quila Express
context: The 13111/13112 Lal Quila Express was an express train belonging to Indian Railways that runs between Kolkata and Delhi Junction in India. It operates as train number 13111 from Kolkata to Delhi Junction and as train number 13112 in the reverse direction. It is named after the Red Fort which is located in Delhi. The word Lal Quila means Red Fort in Devanagari.

title: Lalkuan - Amritsar Express
context: The Lalkuan - Amritsar Express is a express train belonging to Northern Railway zone that runs between Lalkuan Junction and Amritsar Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 14615/14616 train numbers on weelky basis.

title: Lichchavi Express
context:
The 14006 / 05 Anand Vihar Terminal Sitamarhi Lichchavi Express (Hindi:लिच्छवी एक्सप्रेस) is an Express train belonging to Indian Railways - Northern Railway zone that runs between Anand Vihar Terminal & Sitamarhi in India.
It operates as train number 14006 from Anand Vihar Terminal to Sitamarhi and as train number 14005 in the reverse direction serving the states of Bihar, Uttar Pradesh & Delhi.
It is named after the Licchavi (kingdom) - (also Lichchhavi, Lichavi) which was an ancient kingdom in Nepal, which existed in the Kathmandu Valley.

title: Lohit Express
context:
The 15651 / 52 Guwahati Jammu Tawi Lohit Express is a Express train belonging to Indian Railways - Northeast Frontier Railway zone that runs between Guwahati & Jammu Tawi in India.
It operates as train number 15651 from Guwahati to Jammu Tawi and as train number 15652 in the reverse direction serving the 8 states of Assam, West Bengal, Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Haryana, Punjab & Jammu and Kashmir.
It is named after the Lohit River which flows through the Indian states of Arunachal Pradesh and Assam and is 1 of 2 trains that connect Guwahati and Jammu Tawi, the other being the Amarnath Express.

title: Lok Shakti Express
context:
The 22927 / 22928 Bandra Terminus Ahmedabad Lok Shakti Express is a Express train belonging to Indian Railways that runs between Mumbai & Ahmedabad in India. It is a daily service.
It operates as train number 22927 from Bandra Terminus to Ahmedabad and as train number 22928 in the reverse direction. The name Lok Shakti means People’s Power.
This is one of several train connection between Mumbai & Ahmedabad. Some of the other premier trains are 12267/68 Ahmedabad Duronto Express, 12901/02 Gujarat Mail, 12010 Ahmedabad Shatabdi Express, 22903/04 Bandra Terminus Bhuj AC Superfast Express.

title: Lokmanya Express
context: The Lokmanya Express is a Express train belonging to Indian Railways that run between Gorakhpur Junction and Lokmanya Tilak Terminus, Kurla (Mumbai) in India. It operates as train number 11079 from Gorakhpur Junction to Lokmanya Tilak Terminus and as train number 11080 in the reverse direction.

title: Lokmanya Tilak Terminus - Ajni Express

It operates as train number 11202 from Ajni to Lokmanya Tilak Terminus and as train number 11201 in the reverse direction serving the state of Maharashtra.

title: Lokmanya Tilak Terminus - Azamgarh Weekly Express
context: Lokmanya Tilak Terminus - Azamgarh Weekly Express is an express train of the Indian Railways connecting Lokmanya Tilak Terminus in Maharashtra and Azamgarh of Uttar Pradesh. It is currently being operated with 11053/11054 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Lokmanya Tilak Terminus - Bareilly Weekly Express
context: The Lokmanya Tilak Terminus - Bareilly Weekly Express is a express train belonging to Northern Railway zone that runs between Lokmanya Tilak Terminus and Bareilly Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 14313/14314 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Lokmanya Tilak Terminus - Bidar Express
context: Lokmanya Tilak Terminus - Bidar Express is an express train of the Indian Railways connecting Lokmanya Tilak Terminus in Maharashtra and Bidar of Karnataka. It is currently being operated with 11075/11076 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Lokmanya Tilak Terminus - Chennai Central Weekly Express
context: Lokmanya Tilak Terminus - Chennai Central Weekly Express is an express train of the Indian Railways connecting Lokmanya Tilak Terminus in Maharashtra and Chennai Central of Tamil Nadu. It is currently being operated with 11073/11074 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Lokmanya Tilak Terminus - Coimbatore Express
context: Lokmanya Tilak Terminus–Coimbatore Express (train number: 11013/11014) is a daily express train of Indian Railways and operated by Central Railway zone, running between Lokmanya Tilak Terminus (Mumbai) and Coimbatore Junction.

title: Lokmanya Tilak Terminus Darbhanga Pawan Express
context:
The 11061 / 11062 Lokmanya Tilak Terminus Mumbai Darbhanga Pawan Express is a Express train belonging to Indian Railways - Central Railway zone that runs between Lokmanya Tilak Terminus Mumbai & Darbhanga Junction in India.
It operates as train number 11061 from Lokmanya Tilak Terminus Mumbai to Darbhanga Junction and as train number 11062 in the reverse direction serving the states of Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh and Bihar [1].

title: Lokmanya Tilak Terminus - Hazur Sahib Nanded Express
context: Lokmanya Tilak Terminus - Hazur Sahib Nanded Express is an intercity train of the Indian Railways connecting Lokmanya Tilak Terminus Kurla in Maharashtra and Hazur Sahib Nanded of Maharashtra. It is currently being operated with 11011/11012 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Lokmanya Tilak Terminus - Karaikal Weekly Express
context: Lokmanya Tilak Terminus - Karaikal Weekly Express is an express train of the Indian Railways connecting Lokmanya Tilak Terminus in Maharashtra and Karaikal of Union Territory of Puducherry. It is currently being operated with 11017/11018 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Lokmanya Tilak Terminus - Madurai Express
context: Lokmanya Tilak Terminus - Madurai Express is an intercity train of the Indian Railways connecting Lokmanya Tilak Terminus in Maharashtra and Madurai Junction of Tamil Nadu. It is currently being operated with 11043/11044 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Lokmanya Tilak Terminus Muzaffarpur Pawan Express
context:
The 11061 / 62 Lokmanya Tilak Terminus Muzaffarpur Pawan Express is a Express train belonging to Indian Railways - Central Railway zone that runs between Lokmanya Tilak Terminus & Muzaffarpur Junction in India.
It operates as train number 11061 from Lokmanya Tilak Terminus to Muzaffarpur Junction and as train number 11062 in the reverse direction serving the states of Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh and Bihar.

title: Lokmanya Tilak Terminus Nizamabad Express
context:
The 11205 / 06 Lokmanya Tilak Terminus Nizamabad Express is an Express train belonging to Indian Railways - Central Railway zone that runs between Lokmanya Tilak Terminus & Nizamabad in India.
It operates as train number 11205 from Lokmanya Tilak Terminus to Nizamabad and as train number 11206 in the reverse direction serving the states of Maharashtra & Telangana.

title: Loknayak Express
context:
The Loknayak Express is an express train belonging to North Eastern Railway zone that runs between Chhapra Junction and Old Delhi in India. It is currently being operated with 15115/15116 train numbers on a weekly basis.
This train is named after Jayaprakash Narayan, a freedom fighter & political leader who remembered especially for leading the mid-1970s opposition against Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, for whose overthrow he called a "total revolution". Lok Nayak means The People's Hero.

title: Lucknow Junction - Chandigarh Express
context: The Lucknow Junction - Chandigarh Express is an express train belonging to North Eastern Railway zone that runs between Lucknow Junction and Chandigarh Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 15011/15012 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Lucknow Junction - Kathgodam Express
context: The Lucknow Junction - Kathgodam Express is an express train belonging to North Eastern Railway zone that runs between Lucknow Junction and Kathgodam in India. It is currently being operated with 15043/15044 train numbers on a tri-weekly basis.

title: Maa Tara Express
context: Maa Tara Express is an Express train of the Indian Railways connecting Sealdah in West Bengal and Rampurhat Junction of West Bengal. It is currently being operated with 13187/13188 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Madurai Dehradun Express
context:
The 12687 / 88 Madurai Dehradun Express is a Superfast express train of Indian Railways - Southern Railway zone that runs between Madurai Junction and Dehradun in India.
It operates as train number 12687 from Madurai Junction to Dehradun and as train number 12688 in the reverse direction serving the states of Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Delhi, Uttar Pradesh & Uttarakhand.
It previously ran only up to Chennai Central being recently extended to Madurai Junction.

title: Mahalaxmi Express
context: The 17411/17412 Mahalaxmi Express is an express train belonging to Indian Railways that runs between Mumbai and Kolhapur in India. It is a daily service. It operates as train number 17411 from Mumbai CST to Kolhapur and as train number 17412 in the reverse direction.

title: Mahanagari Express
context: The 11093/11094 Mahanagari Express is an express train, belonging to Indian Railways, that runs between Mumbai CST and Varanasi Junction in India. It operates as train number 11093 from Mumbai CST to Varanasi Junction and as train number 11094 in the reverse direction.

title: Mahaparinirvan Express
context:
The Buddhist Circuit Train which is popularly known as Mahaparinirvan Express is a tourist train, which was launched by IRCTC on March 28 2007, to attract Buddhist pilgrims.
The train takes passengers for 08 days/07 nights on spiritual tour which includes visit of various Buddhist places across Northern India.

title: Maharashtra Express
context:
The 11039 ⇋ 11040 Maharashtra Express is an express train belonging to Indian Railways that run between Gondia and Kolhapur in India. It operates as train number 11040 from Gondia railway station to Kolhapur and as train number 11039 in the reverse direction.
This train is named after the state of Maharashtra. Although its name puts it in the league of trains named after their states .i.e. Kerala Express, Tamil Nadu Express, Telangana Express, Andhra Pradesh Express, it does not connect the State & National Capitals.

title: Maithili Express
context: Maithili express is mail/express type train of Indian Railways connecting Kolkata with Darbhanga.It covers a distance of 539 Kilometers at average speed of 49 Kmph.General,AC two tier,Ac three tier,Sleeper type of classes are there in this train,all the classes except general requires prior reservations.No Pantry car is there in this train, Tatkal scheme is available.It is hauled by WAM 4, WAP 4 and WDM 3A class of locos.

title: Maitree Express
context: The Maitree Express (Hindi: मैत्री एक्सप्रेस), or Moitree Express (Bengali: মৈত্রী এক্সপ্রেস), is the name of the first modern international passenger train service connecting Bangladesh to the Indian state of West Bengal. The name Maitree Express means the Friendship Express, denoting the significance of the train service to the foreign relations between India and Bangladesh. Train services between the two countries existed before the partition of India – the Maitree Express re-established this connection between the Bangladeshi capital of Dhaka with Kolkata, the capital of the Indian state of West Bengal, in 2008 after being closed for 43 years. In 2017 a second service, the Bandhan Express, was inaugurated connecting Kolkata with the Bangladeshi city of Khulna, recreating the previous Barisal Express route.

title: Malabar Express
context: The Malabar Express (Malayalam: മലബാര്‍ എക്സ്പ്രസ്സ്‌) is a train service in India, named after the Malabar coast, the south-western coastal region of India from Mangalore Central to Thiruvananthapuram Central. As the name suggests, it connects the Malabar region in north Kerala to the south. The train has one of the longest running time between Mangalore and Thiruvananthapuram Central. It Shares its Rake with 16603/04 Maveli Express, 12601/02 Mangalore Central-Chennai Central Superfast Mail and 22637/38 West Coast Super Fast Express.Malabar Express is one of the most popular trains in Kerala.

title: Malani Express
context: The Malani Expresss is a express train belonging to Northern Railway zone that runs between Old Delhi and Jaisalmer in India. It is currently being operated with 14659/14660 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Malda Town - Anand Vihar Weekly Express
context:
Malda Town - Anand Vihar Weekly Express is the Mail/Express, as well as the like other normal Mail/Express trains. It is the newer one train.
The Malda Town - Anand Vihar Weekly Express left Malda Town railway station for Anand Vihar Terminal railway station, to cover a distance of 1,412 km (877 mi)  km in 29 hours 30 mins. It Had an 1 AC 2 Tier, 2 AC 3-tier and 6 3-Tier Sleeper. It is Held by Indian locomotive class WDM-3A Tughlakabad.

title: Malda Town - New Delhi Express
context: The Malda Town - New Delhi Express is a express train belonging to Northern Railway zone that runs between Malda Town and New Delhi in India. It is currently being operated with 14003/14004 train numbers on bi-weekly basis.

title: Malda Town - Patna Express
context: The Malda Town - Patna Express is a express train belonging to Eastern Railway zone that runs between Malda Town and Patna Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 13415/13416 train numbers on tri-weekly basis.

title: Malgudi Express
context:
The 16023 / 24 Mysore Junction Yesvantpur Junction Malgudi Express is an Express train of the Express/Mail series belonging to Indian Railways – Southern Railway zone that runs between Mysore Junction and Yesvantpur Junction in India.
It operates as train number 16023 from Mysore Junction to Yesvantpur Junction and as train number 16024 in the reverse direction serving the state of Karnataka.

title: Mandore Express
context:
The Mandore Express (Train Codes: 12462/12461) is a superfast express train on India's broad gauge network, connecting Jodhpur (code: JU) and Old Delhi (code: DLI), a distance of approximately 619 km. The train runs on Indian Railways broad gauge line. The train gets a WDP 4 class of EMD locomotive and has a top speed of 110 km/h. The train has sleeper class, ac 3 tier, ac 2 tier and ac first class of accommodation.



It has a rake sharing agreement with 12479 / 80 Suryanagri Express.

title: Mandovi Express
context:
The Mumbai-Madgaon Mandovi Express is a train which operates between Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus and Madgaon Junction, the main railway station in Goa and is currently operated by the Central Railway and the Konkan Railway. It runs daily with a total travel time of 11 hours and 50 minutes. It has 18 stops on its route. It covers a distance of 580 km. This train is named after the Mandovi River.
In previous years before the Konkan Railway came into existence, it used to run between Vasco and Miraj as the Vasco-Miraj MG train and after the Konkan Railway came into existence, it was diverted and made to run from Mumbai to Madgaon and renamed Mandovi Express by Rail Minister Nitish Kumar. In earlier years it used to run with WDM 3a/d of Kalyan/Erode shed and in 2000 it was given WDP 4 of Krishnarajpuram.It is now hauled by a WDP 4 of Hubli.

title: Mandsaur - Meerut City Link Express
context: The Mandsaur- Meerut City Link Express is an express train belonging to Western Railway zone that runs between Mandsaur and Meerut City Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 29019/29020 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Manduadih - Jabalpur Express
context: The Manduadih - Jabalpur Express is an express train belonging to North Eastern Railway zone that runs between Manduadih and Jabalpur Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 15117/15118 train numbers on a weekly basis.

title: Mangala Lakshadweep Express
context: The Mangala Lakshadweep (Malayalam: മംഗള ലക്ഷദ്വീപ് എക്സ്പ്രസ്സ്)is a daily running Superfast Express train of Southern Railway and runs between Hazrat Nizamuddin railway station in Delhi and Ernakulam Junction in Kochi, Kerala via the Konkan railway route. It is currently being operated with 12617 / 12618 train numbers. This was the second daily train connecting Kerala state and New Delhi after Kerala Express and provided the first daily direct access to the national capital for the Malabar(North Kerala) districts and Coastal Karnataka districts. This train currently holds the record of being the longest running daily superfast train in India(3066 km in 48 hrs: 45 minutes at a rate of 63 km/hour). The next longest Superfast also is a train connecting Kerala state with the national capital, the Kerala Express running between Thiruvananthapuram Central and New Delhi which runs 3036 km daily in 50 hrs: 45 minutes at a rate of 60 km/hour.

title: Mangalore Central - Kacheguda Express
context: The Mangalore Central - Kacheguda Express is an express train belonging to South Central Railway zone that runs between Mangalore Central and Kacheguda in India. It is currently being operated with 17605/17606 train numbers on bi-weekly basis.

title: Mangalore Mail
context:
The 12601 Mangalore Mail(alternatively the 12602 Chennai Mail) is a super fast daily operated by the Indian Railways(Southern Railway) between the cities of Chennai and Mangalore via several places of importance including Vellore(Katpadi), Salem, Erode, Tirupur, Coimbatore(Podanur), Palakkad, Kozhikode and Kannur. This train is considered by many to be the contemparary to the Thiruvananthapuram Mail. Just like the Trivandrum mail which has more stops in South Kerala, this train has more stops in North Kerala (Malabar region), mainly between Shoranur Junction and Mangalore Central showing that this train is chiefly meant for the people of this region.
The train shares its rake with the West Coast Express that also traverses the same route.

title: Mangla Lakshdweep Express
context:
The Mangala Lakshadweep SuperFast Express is a daily passenger train from New Delhi's Hazrat Nizamuddin Railway Station to Ernakulam Junction Railway Station in Kerala state via the Konkan Railway line. It began service on 1 August 1998.
The Mangala Express' route is the longest offered in India at 2,761 kilometers, with a running time of 48 hours 45 minutes.

title: Mannai Express
context: The Mannai Express is an express train operated by the Southern Railway zone of the Indian Railways. This train connects Chennai Egmore and Mannargudi in the Indian state of Tamil Nadu. The traffic was opened in 2011.

title: Manuguru Express
context:
Manuguru Express is a super fast train in India that daily runs between Secunderabad, Telangana and Manuguru town in Khammam District of Telangana.
Manugur express timings are 23.45 from secunderabad

title: Manwar Sangam Express
context: The Manwar Sangam Express is a express train belonging to North Central Railway zone that runs between Allahabad Junction and Basti in India. It is currently being operated with 14117/14118 train numbers on five days in a week for every direction.

title: Marathwada Express
context: The Marathwada Express is a train that connects Manmad and Dharmabad. It is also known as the High Court Express. During its journey, it connects many important places in Marathwada such as Aurangabad, Jalna, Parbhani and Potul,Lasur,Nagarsol,Nanded.

title: Marudhar Express
context:
The 14853 / 54 / 63 / 64 / 65 / 66 Jodhpur Varanasi Marudhar (मरुधर) Express is an Express train belonging to Indian Railways - North Western Railway zone that runs between Jodhpur Junction & Varanasi Junction in India.
It operates as train number 14854 / 64 / 66 from Jodhpur Junction to Varanasi Junction and as train number 14853 / 63 / 65 in the reverse direction serving the states of Uttar Pradesh & Rajasthan.
The word Marudhar translates as Master of Air.

title: Marudhar Express (via Pratapgarh)
context: The Marudhar Express is a express train belonging to North Western Railway zone that runs between Jodhpur Junction and Varanasi Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 14865/14866 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Marudhar Express (via Sultanpur)
context: The Marudhar Express is a express train belonging to North Western Railway zone that runs between Jodhpur Junction and Varanasi Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 14863/14864 train numbers on thrice in a week basis.

title: Marusagar Express
context: The Marusagar Express is a weekly express train that runs between Ajmer and Kochi, connecting Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat, Maharashtra, Goa, Karnataka to Kerala. The train runs through four zones of Indian Railways, travelling 2860 km in around 48 hours. There are 32 halts along the way. It starts from Ajmer on Friday morning and reaches Ernakulam Junction on Sunday early morning, and starts back to Ajmer on Sunday evening to reach Ajmer on Tuesday afternoon.

title: Matsyagandha Express
context: Matsyagandha Express is a daily superfast train running between Lokmanya Tilak Terminus (Mumbai) and Mangalore Central.

title: Maur Dhawaj Express
context:
The 12492 / 12491 Jammu Tawi Barauni Maur Dhawaj Express is a Superfast express train belonging to Indian Railways - Northern Railway zone that runs between Jammu Tawi and Barauni Junction in India.
It operates as train number 12492 from Jammu Tawi to Barauni Junction and as train number 12491 in the reverse direction serving the 6 states of Jammu and Kashmir, Punjab, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand and Bihar.

title: Maurya Express
context:
The Maurya Express is an express train belonging to North Eastern Railway zone that runs between Hatia and Gorakhpur Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 15027/15028 train numbers on daily basis.
Due to the closure of Dhanbad - Chandrapura line, this train was diverted route to Dhanbad - Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose Gomoh - Chandrapura line.

title: Maveli Express
context: The Maveli Express (Malayalam:‌മാവേലി എക്സ്പ്രസ്സ്) is a daily night express train of the Southern Railway Division of Indian Railways connecting Mangalore Central to Trivandrum Central. The train numbers are 16603 and 16604.

title: Millennium Express
context:
The 12645 / 46 Ernakulam Hazrat Nizamuddin Millennium Express is a Superfast express train belonging to Indian Railways - Southern Railway zone that runs between Ernakulam Junction and Hazrat Nizamuddin in India.
It operates as train number 12645 from Ernakulam Junction to Hazrat Nizamuddin and as train number 12656 in the reverse direction serving the 8 states of Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh and Delhi [1].

title: Miraj - Hubballi Express
context: Miraj - Hubballi Express is an intercity train of the Indian Railways connecting Miraj Junction in Maharashtra and Hubballi Junction of Karnataka. It is currently being operated with 11047/11048 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Mithila Express
context:
The 13021 / 13022 Howrah Junction-Raxaul railway station Mithila Express is a Mail/Express express train belonging to Indian Railways - Eastern Railway zone that runs between Howrah Junction and Raxaul railway station in India.
It operates as train number 13021 from Howrah Junction to Raxaul railway station and as train number 13022 in the reverse direction serving the states of Bihar, Jharkhand & West Bengal.

title: Mithilanchal Express
context: The Mithilanchal Express is a express train belonging to Eastern Railway zone that runs between Kolkata and Sitamarhi Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 13155/13156 train numbers on twice in a week basis.

title: Firozpur Janata Express
context:
The 19023/19024 Firozpur Janata Express is 1 of 2 express train belonging to Indian Railways that run between Mumbai Central and Firozpur Cantonment in India.
It operates as train number 19023 from Mumbai Central to Firozpur Cantonment and as train number 19024 in the reverse direction serving the states of Maharashtra, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, Haryana, Delhi & Punjab.
It is one of the Janata series of trains thus it has only non air-conditioned coaches. Janata means "common people" in Devanagari.

title: Mumbai CST Amritsar Express
context:
The 11057 / 58 Mumbai CST Amritsar Express is an Express train belonging to Indian Railways - Central Railway zone that runs between Mumbai CST & Amritsar Junction in India It operates as train number 11057 from Mumbai CST to Amritsar Junction and as train number 11058 in the reverse direction serving the states of Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, Haryana, Delhi and Punjab.
It is one of three trains that connect Mumbai & Amritsar, the other trains being the 12903 / 04 Golden Temple Mail & 12925 / 26 Paschim Express. However the 12903 / 04 Golden Temple Mail & 12925 / 26 Paschim Express are operated by Western Railways and have a different routing.

title: Mumbai CST Chennai Express
context: The Mumbai Chennai Express is an Indian Railways train which travels between Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus, Mumbai, India and Chennai Central. This train is numbered 11041 for the Mumbai-Chennai run and 11042 for the Chennai-Mumbai run.

title: Mumbai Chennai Mail
context:
The 11027 / 11028 Mumbai CST Chennai Mail is a train belonging to Indian Railways - Central Railway zone that runs between Mumbai CST & Chennai Central in India.
It operates as train number 11027 from Mumbai CST to Chennai Central and as train number 11028 in the reverse direction serving the states of Maharashtra, Karnataka, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh & Tamil Nadu.

title: Hyderabad Mumbai Express
context:
The Hyderabad Mumbai Express, also known as the Mumbai Express, is a daily train linking Hyderabad City and Mumbai. The train shares the rakes of Hussainsagar Express and follows the same route, though the latter is a superfast express. The train manifests as 17031 Mumbai – Hyderabad Mumbai Express and 17032 Hyderabad – Mumbai Mumbai Express. The train has AC First Class.
17032 hyd-cst express contains three AC coaches: one three-tier AC(b1), one two-tier AC (a1)-and one AC first cum two tier AC (ha1).
17031 cst-hyd express also contain 3 AC coaches: two three-tier AC(b1&b2), one AC two-tier(a1).
Mumbai express departs Hyderabad at 08:40 PM and reach Mumbai at 01:05 PM. Hyderabad express departs Mumbai at 12:45 PM and reach Hyderabad Deccan at 05:55 AM. This train takes total 26 halts including the destination points during to and fro journey. This year's history of the train shows that most of the times this train runs late than schedule.

title: Kanyakumari Mumbai Express
context:
The 16382/16381 Kanyakumari Mumbai Express or Jayanti Janata Express is an Express train belonging to Indian Railways that runs between Kanyakumari and Mumbai CST in India. It is the first and oldest train service that travels from Mumbai to South India.
It operates as train number 16382 from Kanyakumari to Mumbai CST and as train number 16381 in the reverse direction.

title: Mumbai CST - Nagercoil Balaji Express
context: The Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus - Nagercoil Balaji Express is an express train belonging to Southern Railway zone that runs between Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus and Nagercoil Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 16351/16352 train numbers on bi-weekly basis.

title: Mumbai Nagercoil Express
context: Mumbai-Nagercoil Express runs between Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus (CST) Railway Station at Mumbai, Maharashtra, and Nagercoil Railway Station in Tamil Nadu. Main cities on the way are Tirunelveli, Virudhunagar, Madurai, Erode, Salem, Bangalore (bypasses at Krishnarajapura) Hindupur, Anantapur, Adoni, Solapur, Pune and Lonavala. This train covers a distance of 1,952 km.

title: Mumbai CST - Thiruvananthapuram Weekly Express
context: The Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus - Thiruvananthapuram Weekly Express is an express train belonging to Southern Railway zone that runs between Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus and Thiruvananthapuram Central in India. It is currently being operated with 16331/16332 train numbers on weekly basis.

title: Muri Express
context:
The 18101 / 02 Tatanagar Jammu Tawi Muri Express is an Express train belonging to Indian Railways - South Eastern Railway zone that runs between Tatanagar Junction & Jammu Tawi in India.
It operates as train number 18101 from Tatanagar Junction to Jammu Tawi and as train number 18102 in the reverse direction serving the states of Jharkhand, Uttar Pradesh, Delhi, Haryana, Punjab and Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Mussoorie Express
context:
The 14041/42 Delhi Sarai Rohilla Dehradun Mussoorie Express is a Express train belonging to Indian Railways - Northern Railways zone that runs between Delhi Sarai Rohilla and Dehradun in India.
It operates as train number 14041 from Delhi Sarai Rohilla to Dehradun and as train number 14042 in the reverse direction.

title: Muzaffarpur - Narkatiaganj Express
context: The Muzaffarpur - Narkatiaganj Express is an express train belonging to East Central Railway zone that runs between Muzaffarpur Junction and Narkatiaganj Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 15215/15216 train numbers on a daily basis.

title: Mysore - Dharwad Express
context: The Mysore – Dharwad Express is a express train belonging to South Western Railway zone that runs between Dharwad Junction and Mysore Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 17301/17302 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Jaipur Mysore Superfast Express
context:
The 12975/12976 Jaipur Mysore Superfast Express is Superfast express train belonging to Indian Railways that runs between Jaipur Junction and Mysore Junction in India.
It operates as train number 12976 from Jaipur Junction to Mysore Junction and as train number 12975 in the reverse direction.

title: Mysore - Talaguppa Express
context: The Mysuru - Talaguppa Express is an express train belonging to South Western Railway zone that runs between Mysore Junction and Talguppa in India. It is currently being operated with 16227/16228 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Mysore - Varanasi Express
context: The Mysore - Varanasi Express is a express train belonging to South Western Railway zone that runs between Mysore Junction and Varanasi Junction in India. It is currently being operated with 16229/16230 train numbers on twice in a week basis.

title: Nabadwip Dham - Malda Town Express
context: The Nabadwip Dham - Malda Town Express is a express train belonging to Eastern Railway zone that runs between Malda Town and Nabadwip Dham in India. It is currently being operated with 13421/13422 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Nagaland Express
context: The Nagaland Express is a daily Mail/Express train which runs between Kamakhya railway station in Guwahati, the capital city of Assam and Dimapur in Nagaland.

title: Nagarjuna Express
context: The Nagarjuna Express was a train operating on the South Central Railway division of the Indian Railways in India.

title: Nagavali Express
context: The Nagawali Express or Nagavali Express is a train belonging to East Coast Railway. It runs between Sambalpur to Nanded as a Bi-Weekly Express train. The train first ran between Sambalpur and Nizamabad on 23 March 2003. This train was later extended from Nizamabad to Hazur Sahib Nanded. The frequency was increased from Bi-Weekly to Tri-Weekly in Rail budget 2013. It was named after Nagavali River

title: Nagpur - CSMT Kolhapur Express
context: Nagpur - CSMT Kolhapur Express is an express train of the Indian Railways connecting Nagpur Junction in Maharashtra and Chhatrapati Shahu Maharaj Terminus of Maharashtra. It is currently being operated with 11403/11404 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Nagpur - Jaipur Weekly Express
context: The Jaipur - Nagpur Weekly Express is an express train which runs between Nagpur Junction railway station of Nagpur in Maharashtra and Jaipur of Rajasthan. It is currently being operated with 11203/11204 train numbers on daily basis.

title: Nagpur Jabalpur Express
context:
The 58839 / 40 Nagpur Jabalpur express is an passenger train belonging to Indian Railways - South East Central Railway zone that runs between Nagpur Junction and Jabalpur Junction in India.
It operates as train number 58839 from Nagpur Junction to Jabalpur Junction and as train number 58840 in the reverse direction serving the states of Maharashtra & Madhya Pradesh.

title: Nandan Kanan Express
context:
